question: Match the following (Angiosperm ovules & structures):
column_I: Pollen grain and ovule development site
matches: Ovules in angiosperms – Enclosed in fruits
Pollen grain and ovule development site – Flowers
Specialised structures in flowering plants – Flowers
answer: Ovules in gymnosperms – Naked, Ovules in angiosperms – Enclosed in fruits, Pollen grain and ovule development site – Flowers, Seeds in angiosperms – Enclosed, Specialised structures in flowering plants – Flowers

question: Match the following (Angiosperm size & economic importance):
column_I: Plant group providing food, fodder, fuel, medicines
matches: Range of habitats – Wide range of habitats
Plant group providing food, fodder, fuel, medicines – Angiosperms
answer: Range of habitats – Wide range of habitats, Smallest angiosperm – Wolffia, Tallest angiosperm – Eucalyptus, Height of Eucalyptus – Over 100 metres, Plant group providing food, fodder, fuel, medicines – Angiosperms

question: Match the following (Angiosperm classification):
matches: Commercially important plant group – Provide several products
Group name for flowering plants – Angiosperms
General classification of angiosperms – Dicotyledons and monocotyledons
answer: Dicotyledons – One class of angiosperms, Monocotyledons – Other class of angiosperms, Commercially important plant group – Provide several products, Group name for flowering plants – Angiosperms, General classification of angiosperms – Dicotyledons and monocotyledons
